availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John S. Bryan (Christian County, Kentucky, attorney and county court clerk)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, attorney and clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Lovicia J. Richardson Bryan in Polk County, Georgia, on December 1, 1863. Father of Carrie Bryan and Walter Bryan. Attorney in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned forty-six enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. County court clerk in Christian County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 669.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 271B-272A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 418A.
Georgia Marriage Records, Georgia State Archives, Morrow, Georgia, Polk County Marriages, 1852-1880, Film 005191034, p. 267.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Christian County, KY, July-August 1863, p. 6.
"John Sharp Bryan (1828-1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial 88316340, accessed October 10, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88316340.
